00021 //TODO: Change the ping list to be dynamic, responding to the length which the master sends out, how many number of units on the bus

00024 bus_struct_ping_status ping_list[DEF_NR_DEVICES];
00025 
00027 void bus_ping_init(void) {
00028         for (unsigned char i=0;i<DEF_NR_DEVICES;i++) {
00029                 ping_list[i].addr = 0;
00030                 ping_list[i].device_type = 0;
00031                 ping_list[i].time_last_ping = 0;
00032                 ping_list[i].flags = 0;
00033         }
00034 }
00035 
00041 void bus_ping_new_stamp(unsigned char from_addr, unsigned char device_type, unsigned char data_len, unsigned char *data) {
00042         ping_list[from_addr-1].addr = from_addr;
00043         ping_list[from_addr-1].device_type = device_type;
00044         
00045         if (data_len > 0) {
00046                 for (unsigned char i=0;i<data_len;i++)
00047                         ping_list[from_addr-1].data[i] = data[i];
00048         }
00049         
00050         ping_list[from_addr-1].time_last_ping = 0;
00051         
00052         //Reset the flags which need to be reset
00053         ping_list[from_addr-1].flags &= ~(1<<PING_FLAG_PROCESSED);
00054 }
00055 
00057 void bus_ping_tick(void) {
00058         //Goes through the ping list and increase their last ping_time with 1ms
00059         for (unsigned char i=0;i<DEF_NR_DEVICES;i++) {
00060                 ping_list[i].time_last_ping++;
00061         }
00062 }
00063 
00066 bus_struct_ping_status *bus_ping_get_failed_ping(void) {
00067         unsigned char temp=255;
00068         
00069         for (unsigned char i=0;i<DEF_NR_DEVICES;i++)
00070                 if ((ping_list[i].time_last_ping > BUS_PING_TIMEOUT_LIMIT) && ((ping_list[i].flags & (1<<PING_FLAG_PROCESSED)) == 0)) {
00071                         
00072                         temp = i;
00073                         ping_list[i].flags |= (1<<PING_FLAG_PROCESSED);
00074                 }
00075                 
00076         if (temp != 255)
00077                 return(&ping_list[temp]);
00078         else
00079                 return(NULL);
00080 }
00081 
00084 unsigned char bus_ping_get_failed_count(void) {
00085         unsigned char count=0;
00086         
00087         //Goes through the ping list and check how many failed pings there is
00088         for (unsigned char i=0;i<DEF_NR_DEVICES;i++) {
00089                 if (ping_list[i].time_last_ping > BUS_PING_TIMEOUT_LIMIT)
00090                         count++;
00091         }
00092         
00093         return(count);
00094 }
00095 
00099 bus_struct_ping_status *bus_ping_get_ping_data(unsigned char index) {
00100         return(&ping_list[index]);
00101 }
